name.name: brainGraph - Graph Theory Analysis of Brain MRI Data in R

software.description:
brainGraph is an R package containing tools for graph theory (network) analysis of brain MRI data. It was initially developed with a focus on Freesurfer data (i.e., cortical thickness, surface area, volume, etc.) but also works with DTI tractography data (particularly from FSL's "probtrackx2"), and should work with resting-state fMRI data (given correlation matrices).

In addition to general network operations (available through the R package "igraph"), there is code to perform: bootstrapping, permutation tests, random graph generation, small-worldness/efficiency, robustness/targeted attack/random failure analysis, rich-club analysis, and more. Additionally, there is a GUI for quick data viewing and exploration.

For more information, please visit the GitHub page at: https://github.com/cwatson/brainGraph
From there, you will find a link to the User Guide, which is also accessible through the "Docs" link here on the NITRC page.
